NYT > Baseball http://www.nytimes.com/pages/sports/baseball/index.html?partner=rss&emc=rss Baseball en-us Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company Thu, 27 Aug 2015 04:29:14 GMT Thu, 27 Aug 2015 04:29:14 GMT 2 NYT > Baseball http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/misc/NYT_logo_rss_250x40.png http://www.nytimes.com/pages/sports/baseball/index.html?partner=rss&emc=rss Cardinals Beat Diamondbacks 3-1 Behind Lackey http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49542ec6/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C270Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbn0Ecardinals0Ediamondbacks0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm John Lackey pitched seven strong innings and the St. Louis Cardinals beat Arizona 3-1 on Wednesday night, their seventh straight win over the Diamondbacks.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 04:27:34 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/27/sports/baseball/ap-bbn-cardinals-diamondbacks.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Sports Briefing | Little League: Pennsylvania Advances at Little League World Series http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49542ec8/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0C20A150C0A80C270Csports0Cbaseball0Cpennsylvania0Eadvances0Eat0Elittle0Eleague0Eworld0Eseries0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Adam Cramer struck out 13 in five innings, and Lewisberry, Pa., reached the final of the United States bracket by beating Pearland, Tex., 3-0.









Baseball Little League World Series Lewisberry (Pa) Japan Pearland (Tex) Thu, 27 Aug 2015 04:26:51 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/27/sports/baseball/pennsylvania-advances-at-little-league-world-series.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Verlander Takes No-Hit Bid Into 9th, Tigers Beat Angels 5-0 http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49539745/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Eangels0Etigers0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Justin Verlander leaned forward a bit, hoping this line drive would land foul.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 04:12:37 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bba-angels-tigers.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Roundup: No-Hitter Slips Away From Verlander in 9th http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/495368d9/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0C20A150C0A80C270Csports0Cbaseball0Cmlb0Eroundup0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Justin Verlander lost a bid for his third no-hitter when Chris Iannetta lined a double to lead off the ninth inning, but the Tigers beat the visiting Angels, 5-0.









Tampa Bay Rays Baseball Texas Rangers Minnesota Twins Seattle Mariners Sports Injuries Thu, 27 Aug 2015 04:06:13 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/27/sports/baseball/mlb-roundup.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Carlos Osorio/Associated Press Justin Verlander finished the Tigers’ victory over the Angels with a one-hit shutout, missing out on his third career no-hitter. Encarnacion Helps Price Celebrate 30th, Jays Top Texas 12-4 http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/4953f579/sc/35/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Eblue0Ejays0Erangers0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Edwin Encarnacion hit a grand slam to extend his hitting streak to 21 games, helping David Price get a win on his 30th birthday in Toronto's 12-4 victory against the Texas Rangers on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 03:45:31 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bba-blue-jays-rangers.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Baseball Capsules http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/4953f57a/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbo0Ebaseball0Ecapsules0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Justin Verlander lost a bid for his third no-hitter when Chris Iannetta lined a leadoff double in the ninth inning that landed on the left-field line, and the Detroit Tigers beat the Los Angeles Angels 5-0 Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 03:39:35 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbo-baseball-capsules.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Trio of 2-Run Shots Power Orioles to 8-5 Win Over Royals http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541414/sc/35/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Eorioles0Eroyals0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Chris Davis, Manny Machado and Jonathan Schoop each hit a two-run homer off Johnny Cueto, and the Baltimore Orioles totaled five long balls in all Wednesday night to power their way to an 8-5 victory over the Kansas City Royals that snapped a six-game skid.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 03:25:21 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bba-orioles-royals.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Kipnis Has HR, 3 RBIs to Lead Indians Past Brewers, 6-2 http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541413/sc/28/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbo0Ebrewers0Eindians0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Jason Kipnis homered and drove in three runs, and the Cleveland Indians used six pitchers in a 6-2 win over the Milwaukee Brewers on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 03:14:09 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbo-brewers-indians.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Porcello Pitches Red Sox Past Sale, White Sox 3-0 http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541415/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Ered0Esox0Ewhite0Esox0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Rick Porcello pitched seven sparkling innings in his return from a triceps injury, leading the Boston Red Sox to a 3-0 victory over the Chicago White Sox on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 03:02:05 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bba-red-sox-white-sox.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Mets 9, Phillies 4: A New Mets Outlook, and the Wins Keep Coming http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541412/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0C20A150C0A80C270Csports0Cbaseball0Ca0Enew0Emets0Eoutlook0Eand0Ethe0Ewins0Ekeep0Ecoming0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm There is a different aura surrounding the Mets, who are guaranteed to enter September in first place after a win Wednesday night in Philadelphia.









Baseball Collins, Terry L New York Mets Colon, Bartolo Philadelphia Phillies Thu, 27 Aug 2015 02:58:26 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/27/sports/baseball/a-new-mets-outlook-and-the-wins-keep-coming.html SETH BERKMAN Michael Perez/Associated Press Yoenis Cespedes was greeted by Wilmer Flores after scoring on a double by Michael Cuddyer during a three-run first inning on Wednesday night. Escobar Hits 2 Homers, Twins Beat Rays 5-3 http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541417/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Etwins0Erays0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Eduardo Escobar homered twice and Joe Mauer had a tiebreaking RBI single as Minnesota beat the Tampa Bay Rays 5-3 Wednesday night for the Twins' sixth consecutive win.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 02:56:05 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bba-twins-rays.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Dodgers Ride 3 Homers to 7-4 Win Over Reds http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541416/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbn0Edodgers0Ereds0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Scott Van Slyke, A.J. Ellis and Yasiel Puig homered during a five-run fourth inning, and the Los Angeles Dodgers held on for a 7-4 victory over the Cincinnati Reds on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 02:56:03 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbn-dodgers-reds.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Barnes Has 3 Hits to Lead Rockies to 6-3 Win Over Braves http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49541418/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbn0Erockies0Ebraves0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Brandon Barnes had three hits, including a two-run homer, and the Colorado Rockies extended Atlanta right-hander Shelby Miller's winless streak to 18 starts with a 6-3 victory over the Braves on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 02:56:02 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbn-rockies-braves.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Colon Tosses 7 Scoreless Innings, Mets Beat Phillies 9-4 http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49539744/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbn0Emets0Ephillies0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Bartolo Colon tossed five-hit ball and struck out eight in seven sharp innings, Michael Cuddyer hit a long homer and the NL East-leading New York Mets beat the Philadelphia Phillies 9-4 on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 02:28:51 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbn-mets-phillies.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS McCutchen's 4 RBIs Lead Pirates to 7-2 Win http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49539746/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbn0Epirates0Emarlins0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Andrew McCutchen homered and drove in four runs to help the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 7-2 victory over the Miami Marlins on Wednesday night.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 01:53:10 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbn-pirates-marlins.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS LEADING OFF: Cubs Face Bumgarner; Greinke Looks for Rebound http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49536dd7/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebbo0Eleading0Eoff0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm A look at what's happening all around the major leagues on Thursday:









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 01:40:41 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bbo-leading-off.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Iannetta Ends Verlander's No-Hit Bid With No Outs in 9th http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49536dda/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Etigers0Everlander0Eno0Ehitter0Ealert0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm The Los Angeles Angels' Chris Iannetta hit a leadoff double off the chalk on the left field line to end Justin Verlander's no-hit bid for the Detroit Tigers in the ninth inning.









Thu, 27 Aug 2015 01:28:40 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/08/26/sports/baseball/ap-bba-tigers-verlander-no-hitter-alert.html THE ASSOCIATED PRESS A Different Kind of Yankee Rotation http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/49536dd4/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0C20A150C0A80C270Csports0Cbaseball0Ca0Edifferent0Ekind0Eof0Eyankee0Erotation0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm To keep pitchers’ arms fresh, the Yankees have recalled or demoted a pitcher in 43 transactions this season, about once every three games.









Baseball Scranton/Wilkes-Barre RailRiders Cashman, Brian New York Yankees Thu, 27 Aug 2015 01:14:18 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/27/sports/baseball/a-different-kind-of-yankee-rotation.html BILLY WITZ Brett Carlsen for The New York Times Caleb Cotham, helping with a youth camp, is among the many Yankees pitchers who have shuttled between Scranton and the Bronx. Astros 6, Yankees 2: Missing Two Key Bats, Yankees’ Offense Seems Adrift http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/4951edef/sc/35/l/0L0Snytimes0N0C20A150C0A80C270Csports0Cbaseball0Cmissing0Etwo0Ekey0Ebats0Eyankees0Eoffense0Eseems0Eadrift0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Without Mark Teixeira or Jacoby Ellsbury in the lineup Wednesday afternoon, the Yankees dropped their fifth game in seven days.









Baseball Pineda, Michael Houston Astros Teixeira, Mark Ellsbury, Jacoby New York Yankees Thu, 27 Aug 2015 00:19:55 GMT http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/27/sports/baseball/missing-two-key-bats-yankees-offense-seems-adrift.html ZACH SCHONBRUN Frank Franklin Ii/Associated Press Luis Valbuena sprinted home on Jose Altuve's sacrifice fly after the Astros strung together three straight hits against Michael Pineda in the fifth inning. Bassitt, A's Bullpen Knocked Around in 8-2 Loss to Mariners http://rss.nytimes.com/c/34625/f/640313/s/4952ecde/sc/13/l/0L0Snytimes0N0Caponline0C20A150C0A80C260Csports0Cbaseball0Cap0Ebba0Eathletics0Bhtml0Dpartner0Frss0Gemc0Frss/story01.htm Billy Burns accomplished what only two others had done, greeting Seattle ace Felix Hernandez with a home run leading off the game. On the first pitch, no less.
